layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: I recognize that my relationship with God is MY responsibility — no pastor, spouse, or program can do my spiritual work for me.

answers.4: I mostly own my spiritual life, though I sometimes lean on others too much
answers.5: My walk with God is mine — I engage regardless of what others do or don't do
answers.2: I rely heavily on programs or people to keep me spiritually engaged
answers.3: I know it's my job but often wait for external structure to carry me
answers.1: I expect others (church, spouse, pastor) to drive my spiritual growth

questions.text: When my spiritual life feels dry, I look at my own choices and habits first rather than blaming circumstances or others.

answers.4: I generally look inward first, though I occasionally rearrange externals
answers.5: Dryness triggers self-examination — what have I neglected or avoided?
answers.2: I usually adjust my circumstances — new app, new routine, new setting
answers.3: I sometimes examine myself, but often adjust external things first
answers.1: When I'm dry, I look for a new church, group, or environment to fix it

questions.text: I own that creating time and space for God is my job — I don't wait for the 'right conditions' to appear.
questions.principle: If it's to be, it's up to me

answers.4: I guard spiritual time, though urgent things occasionally displace it
answers.5: Time with God is non-negotiable — other things flex around it, not the reverse
answers.2: Other priorities regularly push out spiritual time; it only happens when convenient
answers.3: I protect time with God sometimes, but it often loses to other demands
answers.1: Almost anything bumps my time with God — it's first to go when life gets full

questions.text: My upbringing, church experiences, and circumstances have created who I am today.

answers.4: The past shaped me, but my choices shape me more
answers.5: Whatever happened before, what I do with it now is all mine
answers.2: Some things from my past have set limits I can't really get past
answers.3: I take some responsibility, but the past needs to carry some as well
answers.1: My spiritual state makes sense when you consider what I've been through

answers.4: my engagement, but I sometimes get in my own way
answers.5: my reaching out to receive what God has already provided
answers.2: mostly God, though I have to be available
answers.3: I have to reach out to God, but He has to reach out to me
answers.1: God — if He wants me to grow, He'll make it happen
